page.title: 01Watford-N of the Town Centre
page.content: {The landscape of our block is about 60% built up and 40% open space.} The electrified main railway line from London to the NW runs partly through a tunnel. The Grand Union Canal runs through Cassiobury Park to the W. Other examples of transport are Leavesden airport in the N and the new M25 London Orbital motorway crossing the Gade valley on a viaduct at present being built. Much of the housing around the station was built in the latter half of the C19th. Most of the rest was built in the 1920s and 30s with some postwar infilling. {The major industry is Rolls Royce engine works on the airport.} Odhams, the printers has recently closed. There are a number of small industrial estates but housing dominates. Cassiobury Park is Watford's major public open space. {The population of the block is 30.000.}
